intro: Mnemion cheiranthifolium, commonly known as the leafy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branching. Mnemion cheiranthifolium is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
